intro: Astracantha laxiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered astracantha, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a compact cluster, and it produces achenes as its seeds. Astracantha laxiflora is often found in fynbos vegetation, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
